reviews.text: Loved the lobster flight trio, spicy honey butter was my favorite and the service was great!
Molto buono
Posso solo dire che Ã¨ stato il cibo piÃ¹ buono che ho provato a NY ğŸ˜
Great lobster roll and clam chowder. Perfect place to people watch.

On our way to the Paloma Mami concert, all the way from Northern NJ, we decided to do a little sightseeing before the show. After checking out a few spots that didnâ€™t quite catch our attention, my niece spotted Lukeâ€™s Lobster â€” and what a find!

From the moment we ordered, Chelsey was friendly and informative, Arturo prepared our food to absolute perfection, and Tracy, the store manager, made the experience truly special by sharing a bit of the brandâ€™s history and making us feel right at home.

Thank you, Lukeâ€™s Lobster team â€” weâ€™ll definitely be back! ğŸ¦ğŸ’™
Loved the lobster flight. Very delicious, Tracy the manager was super sweet and very welcoming.

Excellent
Lobster roll et Crabe roll parfaits ğŸ˜
Thank you

If you love a great lobster sandwich, this place will not disappoint you. The location is very conveniently located next to the Brooklyn Bridge park. Grab a sandwich and enjoy the beauty of NY skyline and the Brooklyn Bridge. The lobster sandwich and the clam chowder were great
El sÃ¡ndwich de langosta estÃ¡ sÃºper delicioso, yo lo pedÃ­ caliente y me gustÃ³ mucho, pruÃ©balos
Outside seating only

Amazing location, right under the Brooklyn Bridge. Service was top notch, super friendly and great with kids.

Lobster Roll was all meat, cant complain with that! Very fresh, very buttery. Even the kids grilled cheese was great!

A little pricey, but still very good

Panino molto buono, forse lobster troppo freddo per il consumo.
Nel prezzo non ci sono stati date le patatine e nemmeno le bevande quindi oltre 60 dollari (+ tip che con il senno di poi non avrei mai dato) per 2 lobster roll small mi sembra esagerato. I tavoli del locale alle  ore 19.20/19.30 erano giÃ  accatastati e pertanto abbiamo dovuto mangiare nelle panchine del parco pubblico adiacente.

First time at this location and it was absolutely amazing. I had the lobster roll and calm chowder, and it was perfect. The young lady Tracy was a true Gem. She took our orders with and smile and such a great friendly disposition.  In this world we need to give more thanks to hard working individuals that provide great service. I only wish the place was bigger. Will return back soon

The service is extremely slow.  Donâ€™t order the 8oz lobster roll because they donâ€™t know  how to make it.  The charge for 8 oz is $54 per one and they  were very confused how to make it to go. After all the waiting I am not even sure if they made the 8oz or 6 oz.

I Bought a lobster roll and crab roll.  Food looked beautiful but it lacked flavour.  Basically, both sandwiches were bland.  The  food needs some seasoning and reworking of the recipe to become the best lobster roll spot in Brooklyn.
The best lobster ğŸ¦ roll in NY. Theyâ€™re served with a drink and a bag of chips
Sec, petit quantitÃ©. TrÃ¨s pour ce qui est servi.

Good, wholesome, fresh pieces of lobster in your rolls - not shredded or mixed with mayo! Tasty. Expensive though for a grab-and-go place! About $30 for only a 4 ounce roll plus I think around $45 for an 8 ounce roll.
Un robo en toda regla, 30$ por un mini bocadillo sin sabor. Si ponen tilapia en el bocadillo hubiese sido lo mismo.
The food is amazing staff is amazing . Prices arenâ€™t bad at all and Iâ€™ve been coming here for a few years now . I love it here . My name is Dayaa btw lol . I appreciate you guyâ€™s always
Chips is chips :) lobster was delicious

Lukeâ€™s Lobster Ã¨ ovviamente una tappa da fare quando si viene a New York. Noi abbiamo mangiato in quello vicino al ponte di Brooklyn. Il panino non male, sullâ€™astice niente da dire, molto buono! PerÃ², nonostante siano compresi nel prezzo una bibita e un pacchetto di patatine, non vale i 30$ che ti tocca pagare..
Davanti al chiosco vi sono 4 tavolini quindi con molta facilitÃ  si finisce per mangiare in piedi..
CarÃ­simo porque son mini pero muy buenos. Nos atendieron muy mal
Very friendly service and good food. I will definitely be going back for more lobster ğŸ¦ rolls. Place is a little on the pricey side, but was very good.
Chiesto che vende panini con aragosta o altri crostacei. Ottimo cibo, esperienza culinaria top. Servizio rapido. Lo spazio esterno Ã¨ scarsamente ombreggiato o in caso di pioggia non coperto.
Fantastica tappa con vista su Manhattan. Panino con lobster superbo! Consigliatissimo per un cena con vista mozzafiato.

Loved this spot! The lobster rolls are super fresh and tasty, and eating them right by the Brooklyn Bridge with that skyline view is just amazing. Chill vibes, quick service, a bit expensive but honestly worth it for the whole experience.

To byÅ‚ mÃ³j pierwszy homar w Å¼yciuğŸ™ˆ moÅ¼e nie ostatni, bo chciaÅ‚abym go jeszcze sprÃ³bowaÄ‡ w innym wydaniu, w innym miejscu.. Tutaj niestety kanapka z homarem byÅ‚a koszmarnağŸ™ˆ Zimny homar nie smakuje dobrzeğŸ¥´ Niestety, ani ja ani mÄ…Å¼, nie byliÅ›my w stanie jej dokoÅ„czyÄ‡ i obie wylÄ…dowaÅ‚y w Å›mietniku. Knajpka wyglÄ…da jak kiosk, bierzesz do rÄ™ki i w drogÄ™. Jedynie lokalizacja ratuje sytuacjÄ™, bo masz piÄ™kny widok na Manhattan. Niestety nie mogÄ™ poleciÄ‡.

Vam agafar 4 lobster's rolls a 28$ cada un. El roll va acompanyat d'una bosseta de xips + beguda. Si vas amb adolescents es queden amb gana perquÃ¨ l'entrepÃ  Ã©s petit perÃ² menjar-se aquest entrepÃ  davant el pont de Brooklin no tÃ© preu!

Everything perfect.
They still smile when they are crazy busy.
Food is good.
Price is bit too high though.
Le patatine sono quelle in busta, peccato perchÃ© fa scendere di valore il cibo

I liked it.
The roll was garlic bread but good.
The lobster was lacking flavor but over all good.
Great service.
Amazing location and views.
First time at this location..  very nice staff.. quick service.. had the crab sandwich.. was delicious.. outdoor seating..
To die for lobster roll! Authentic just like Maine.
Lobster rolls was good not the best I ever had. Was a little disappointed. Wait time was great and the services was amaze
4 oz lobster roll. It's not cheap but it's definitely worth it. It's absolutely delicious
Good lobsters rolls in Dumbo. Could definitely find better. Also on the pricier side for just being a shack and no service.

This an easy stop and grab a bite to eat place. You just walk up to the window order your food and they bring it to you when itâ€™s ready. I got the 8oz lobster roll. The roll is cold but it was delicious m. Itâ€™s most definitely in my top 5 lobster rolls not the best but pretty tasty. The downside is expensive. $50 for 8oz. They have smaller sizes too if you donâ€™t want to pay that much, plus they also have shrimp and crab rolls too. I recommend trying this place even with the price tag.
Every time I go, Iâ€™m never disappointed. Consistent quality and portions. Concise options. Great service.
Caro ma buonissimo

Die Lobster Roll Combo mit 3 kleinen Rolls mit jeweils einen anderen Geschmack, war sehr lecker. Allerdings finde ich 40$ fÃ¼r 3 kleine Lobster Rolls etwas zu teuer. Geschmacklich sehr gut fÃ¼r Seafoods-Liebhaber, fÃ¼r andere Personen eventuell ungewohnt. Der Service war sehr gut und freundlich, Lobster Roll kann kalt oder warm bestellt werden.
Staff is friendly. Good is good.

Quick friendly service. Lobster roll and clam chowder were nice, portions were on the small side, but this is a prime location. Perhaps I might have preferred lobster bisque to the clam chowder, which I wouldnâ€™t order again.

Great food above all! Bit pricey for what's essentially the fast food concept of the restaurant. A bit slow service. They definitely need more people working for this very heavy traffic (and touristy) location.

This is my go-to lobster takeout spot near the Brooklyn Bridge! The location is perfect â€” right by the river, giving me great vibes to walk around with my food. The lobster is so fresh and sweet, especially paired with the soft bun. I love the mini set that comes with 3 different sauces â€” each one has its own delicious flavor. The clam soup is also amazing. Everything together makes the perfect combo. A must-try if youâ€™re in the area!
The lobster roll was so yummy and fresh, which wrapped up our final day in NYC~
Not up to the hype. Mediocre at best and food quality and quality of ingredients were sub-par. Very high price for the quality and quantity of food.

There was a huge line at lunchtime on a weekend and the line moved extremely slowly. The workers were busy and working fast so they werenâ€™t the friendliest. The food was good but was it worth the wait and the heavy price tag? I donâ€™t think so.

This is my second time eating at this place, only this time I decided to try the Dumbo location.

I ordered the lobster, crab and shrimp trio, in my opinion it is too small, you can see the comparison with my hand.
The bread was okay, the lobster bread was better, and even the crab bread surprised me because it was also good.

My disappointment was the shrimp, they were cold, like when they took them straight from the refrigerator to the plate. No flavor at all, the texture was chewy and I actually ate it to avoid wasting food but it tasted really bad.

It was the only thing I ate for the rest of the day, at night my stomach started to hurt and I felt nauseous. I had severe indigestion all night, I couldn't stop vomiting and the discomfort wouldn't go away.
Hopefully it was indigestion and not food poisoning. But still, it's a resounding Never again for me.

The guy at the register was friendly and the service was quick. My only problem was the disastrous experience with the shrimp there.

Only because of the staff and the beautiful location next to the pier, I give them two stars.

Niente da dire sui panini in se, li ho trovati sufficientemente gustosi e abbondantemente farciti.
Nota sfavorevole per il servizio: scortese, maleducato e soprattutto con un occhio di mal riguardo verso una parte della clientela (forse quella straniera o che capisce poco la lingua).
Il menÃ¹ prevede la fornitura di un panino accompagnato da un pacchetto di patatite + drink.
Peccato che nel mio ordine non vi erano ne patatine e nemmeno drink, che per due panini fanno 4 articoli mancanti.
Alla richiesta di spiegazioni il personale ha risposto in maniera scortese, sbuffando e facendo espressioni spazientite.
Peccato perchÃ¨ il posto, la vista e il sapore meriterebbero sicuramente piÃ¹ attenzione, soprattutto visto il costo.

Tourists alert! Definitely a scam for tourists. Do not eat here. 1) the menu says it comes with chips and soda but the staff insists that we need to pay an extra $2 for that. I saw the other â€œlocalsâ€ have their chips and soda but not us. I asked the â€œlocalsâ€ and they told me the set comes with these. This is clearly a scam and DISCRIMINATION. 2) these lobsters are tasteless. you cannot tell they are lobsters if you are doing a blind test 3) it is a lobster roll flight with 2oz each. You can tell from the picture that one of them is obviously not 2oz.

Edit: They contacted me but instead of offering compensation at the first place, they blamed me as if it was my fault. I pushed back and advised I might report this to authority, and then they stepped back. We definitely need to know our rights.
My family went to tried out their Lobster Roll after walking through the Brooklyn Bridge. The food is tasty but pricey, two big rolls with two cans of soda and chips cost more than $100.

Nice location, just the perfect spot to get your fill after strolling around the bridges. Price is just right and the size is not bad. One good thing is the lobster meat is fresh and 100% lobster. Drop by to take a bite

Beautiful spot under the Brooklyn bridge! The staff were very friendly. The manager Tracy was so kind and told us about the area. She also told us about Lukeâ€™s as a company and the family feel. The lobster rolls were amazing! The lemon pepper one was chefâ€™s kiss! A must visit!

EXCELLENT lobster rolls, great location, but very RUDE and hapless staff! I ordered a lobster roll and a crab roll with my girlfriend for takeout - the first time, everything went smoothly and we were on our way. The lobster roll was so good that I returned for a sampler, but was told rather bluntly that I could not pay with my card because something is wrong with their payment terminal. I was told to withdraw money next door. Due to huge commissions, I did not want to do that, so I asked for another lobster roll instead and asked again if maybe I could pay with my card. This time, the man who took my order looked at the machine and said (rather reluctantly) that I could - very strangeâ€¦ Half an hour goes by and I return to buy a beer, but the same man tells me â€œsorry we are closing in 15 minutes, I canâ€™t sell you beerâ€. What gives? There was a couple waiting in line behind me and he seemed to serve them just fine. I suspect that the treatment I got is the result of me not having tipped when ordering the first time. Shame! There is no expectation to tip when ordering takeout.

EDIT: thank you Tracy for your reply. I will increase my rating by a star for your handling of the situation! Canâ€™t award more for the food, as itâ€™s already the best lobster roll I have ever had :)) (love the abundant claw meat!)
Great lobster rolls although a tad small and definitely expensive, for me at least. Good location with really nice views, would recommend!
